Name: October Apple Pie
Ingredients: 1 recipe pastry for a 9 inch double crust pie
½ cup packed light brown sugar
¼ cup butter, chilled and diced
Steps: 01. In a large bowl, combine apples, lemon juice, sugars, spices, flour, butter, and caramels. Stir to coat fruit evenly.
02. Roll dough out, and cut out two crusts. Line a pie plate with one of the crusts. Spoon filling into the bottom crust, and cover with the top crust. Crimp the edges.
03. Next Place the pie on a baking sheet covered with foil. Poke fork holes over top. Sprinkle lightly with granulated sugar.
04. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 50 minutes. If you notice overbrowning after 30 minutes, reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Serve warm, or at room temperature.

Name: Fruited Ice Cream
Steps: 01. Combine condensed milk, milk, cream, vanilla, salt and fruit in freezer canister of ice cream maker.
02. Freeze according to manufacturer's directions.
03. Serve in a bowl with herbs or Sweet Sauce

Name: Malpua
Ingredients: 1 cup all purpose flour or 125 grams
1 teaspoon fennel seeds - kept whole or crushed
3 to 4 green cardamoms - crushed or ⅓ teaspoon cardamom powder
3 pinches baking soda or ⅛ teaspoon baking soda
½ cup water or 125 ml water or add as required
3 tablespoon khoya (mawa or dried evaporated milk solids) or about 50 grams khoya or 3 tablespoon whole milk powder
2.5 to 3 tablespoon sugar or add as required
5 to 6 green cardamoms - crushed or ½ teaspoon cardamom powder
1 teaspoon rose water or kewra water
Steps: 01. In a mixing bowl take 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tsp fennel seeds, 3 to 4 cardamoms, crushed or 1/3 tsp cardamom powder. Mix the dry ingredients well.
02. Add 3 tbsp khoya and 3 tbsp curd/yogurt. Please use fresh yogurt. Instead of khoya you can also use milk powder.
03. Add 1/2 cup water and begin to stir to a thick flowing batter without lumps.
04. Allow the batter to rest for 30 minutes.
05. Meanwhile when the batter is resting blanch the almonds and pistachios in hot water. Keep them soaked in hot water for 20 to 30 minutes. Then peel and slice them. Keep aside.
06. Heat ghee in a pan or griddle.
07. When the ghee is heating up add 3 pinches soda or 1/8 tsp baking soda to the malpua batter and mix well
08. Lower the flame. Take 2 tbsp to 3 tbsp of the batter and gently pour it on the hot ghee. Spread the batter lightly with the back of the spoon. Make 2 to 4 malpua depending on the size of the pan.
09. Fry on a low to medium till crisp and golden flipping the malpua a couple of times.
10. Drain them on paper towels to remove excess oil.
11. Make Sugar Syrup and Rabri.

12. Rabri in a bowl and serve it later with the malpua. Refrigerate if not using it immediately. The combo of malpua rabdi taste good and is liked by many people. Its best and recommended to have malpua rabdi hot.

Name: Gulab Jamun
Ingredients: ¾ cup grated paneer – 100 grams of paneer (Indian cottage cheese)
4 green cardamoms – powdered in a mortar-pestle or ½ teaspoon cardamom powder
1 tablespoon milk or add as required
oil for deep frying – as required
Steps: 01. Take khoya (mawa or evaporated milk) in a bowl. Mash it very well. There should be no lumps. You can also grate and then mash the khoya.
02. Then add grated paneer, rava (sooji), all purpose flour (maida), baking powder and cardamom powder to the mashed khoya. There should be no lumps in both the mawa and paneer.

03. As if they are there, then you will find the texture of the gulab jamun not so good. The bits and pieces of mava or paneer will give a bite in the mouth, when you have the gulab jamun. They won’t be smooth.
04. Mix well. Add milk and gather together to form a dough with milk. Don’t knead.
05. Just gently mix. If you are unable to form balls or if the mixture appears dry, then add a few teaspoons of milk. Cover the dough and keep aside for 30 mins.
06. Make small balls from the dough. Cover the balls and keep aside.
07. Meanwhile, while the sugar syrup is cooking, heat oil till its medium hot. Lower the flame and wait for a minute. Then gently place the dough balls in the oil.
08. Once they start to have tiny golden spots, keep on rotating them in the oil, so that the jamun are evenly browned.
09. Remove the fried jamun and then drain them on kitchen paper towels to remove excess oil.
10. Then place the hot fried dough balls in the sugar syrup. Continue frying the rest of the dough balls in batches.
11. When all the jamuns are placed in the sugar syrup, then keep the whole pan with the sugar syrup and the gulab jamun, on a low flame for 1 to 2 minutes till the jamun become soft.
12. Serve gulab jamun warm or at room temperature. You can also chill them and serve them cold. Garnish with rose petals or almond slivers.

Name: Pumpkin Cake
Steps: 01. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 12x18 inch pan. Sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. Set aside.
02. In a large bowl combine sugar and oil. Blend in vanilla and pumpkin, then beat in eggs one at a time. Gradually beat in flour mixture. Stir in nuts. Spread batter into prepared 12x18 inch pan.
03. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Allow to cool.
